natural problem:
If $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 5,$ then find
\[\begin{vmatrix} a - c & b - d \\ c & d \end{vmatrix}.\]
natural solution: Since $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 5,$ $ad - bc = 5.$  Then \[\begin{vmatrix} a - c & b - d \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = (a - c)d - (b - d)c = ad - bc = \boxed{5}.\](Why does this make sense geometrically?)

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c d :: real
assumes h0 : "a * d - b * c = 5"
shows  "(a - c) * d - (b - d) * c = 5"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 If $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 5,$ then find
\[\begin{vmatrix} a - c & b - d \\ c & d \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 5
 ### Proof
 Since $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 5,$ $ad - bc = 5.$  Then \[\begin{vmatrix} a - c & b - d \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = (a - c)d - (b - d)c = ad - bc = \boxed{5}.\](Why does this make sense geometrically?)
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c d :: real
assumes h0 : "a * d - b * c = 5"
shows  "(a - c) * d - (b - d) * c = 5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Given that $ad - bc = 5$, find the value of $(a - c)d - (b - d)c$. The final answer is $5$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c d :: real
assumes h0 : "abs(a * d - b * c) = 5"
shows  "abs((a - c) * d - (b - d) * c) = 5"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 If $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 5,$ then find
\[\begin{vmatrix} a - c & b - d \\ c & d \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 5
 ### Proof
 Since $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 5,$ $ad - bc = 5.$  Then \[\begin{vmatrix} a - c & b - d \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = (a - c)d - (b - d)c = ad - bc = \boxed{5}.\](Why does this make sense geometrically?)
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c d :: real
assumes h0 : "abs(a * d - b * c) = 5"
shows  "abs((a - c) * d - (b - d) * c) = 5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Given the absolute value of the result of the product of $a$ and $d$ subtracted by the product of $b$ and $c$ equals $5$, determine that the absolute value of the result of the difference between $a$ and $c$ multiplied by $d$ subtracted by the product of the difference between $b$ and $d$ and $c$ is also $5$.
